reviewText: Lisa is a teenage girl who cannot date, because her mother thinks she is too young. Richard is a serial killer who calls his victims and leaves a message on their answering machine before he kills them. One day their paths cross...The story flows quite naturally as does the dialogue. And the acting is good all over. Still, it never really gets engaging (nor scary). Probably more suiting for a younger (early teens) audience. Not bad, but I don't think I will remember it for very long.In Sweden this film is called "The Candlelight Killer".
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've loved this movie from the first time I saw it.  I'm so happy it's now on DVD.  Stacy Keanan does an amazing job and I found the mother/daughter dynamic relatable.  The phone call prank gone wrong aspect was frightening and left me feeling creeped out even after the movie was over.  That's the sign of an effective movie.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Viewed: 3/13Rate: 53/13: Stupid is as stupid does. That premise describes Lisa the best. Really, Lisa should have died in the end, but the improbable, predictable ending forbade it. For most of the film, it was good, and it had a healthy pace. Then, the ending pretty much killed it all, putting my perspective in place and describing Lisa as a stupid, spoiled brat. Back then, we used to get a list of phone numbers, incoming and outgoing, along with the phone bill, and Richard would have found out the number within a month. All in all, Lisa could do better.

reviewText: a great thriller from 1990 ,I remember renting it on VHS a lot because it was fun and entertaining.It only had maybe a drop or two of blood but it still works as two boy crazy teenage girls prank call the 'Candlelight killer' by accident and become infatuated with him not realizing they are putting everyone they love including themselves in danger.Lisa played by 'Staci Keanan' pretends to be her mom 'Cheryl Ladd' while talking to Richard/The Candle light killer and this is where things get sticky, dangerous and interesting.it's a great little movie starring Cheryl Ladd,Staci Keanan and D.W. Moffett as the candle light killer/ Richard. Again it's very tame in comparison to what I usually watch and review but I have a soft spot for it because it's in the vein of most of the early 90's thrillers.the climatic third act is action packed and has a big fight for survival as a mother a child fight to save each others lives.
Title: N/A

reviewText: HI THERE! I CHOSE THIS MOVIE BECAUSE IT'S ONE OF THE BEST MOVIES I'VE SEEN IN ALONG TIME. THIS IS A STORY ABOUT A REBELLIOUS TEENAGER WHO'S MOM IS TOTALLY OVERPROTECTIVE AND DOESN'T LET HER DO THE THINGS SHE WANTS TO(IN PART DATING). SO LISA ( THE TEENAGER) STARTS CRANK CALLING OLDER GUYS UNTIL ONE DAY THE GUY SHE HAS BEEN TALKING TO FOR WEEKS TURNS OUT TO BE A SERIAL KILLER AND IS KILLING WOMAN ALL OVER THE CITY. THINGS GO FROM BAD TO WORSE WHEN RICK (THE KILLER) FINDS OUT WHO SHE IS, AND WHEN HE ASKS HER" WHAT IS YOUR NAME? LISA GIVES HIM HER MOTHERS NAME AND SHE HAS (THE MOM) NO IDEA WHAT HER DAUGHTER HAS BEEN UP TO. I'M NOT GOING TO GIVE ANYMORE AWAY BECAUSE THAT WOULD GIVE TO MUCH AWAY; BUT SEE IT YOU WON'T REGRET IT. I LOVED THIS MOVIE BECAUSE OF THE REASONS I JUST EXPLAINED. THE ACTOR (KILLER) PLAYED BY D.W. MOFFETT IS SO COMPELLING IN THIS MOVIE;PLUS HE'S SUCH A HUNK.
summary: A MOVIE YOU LOVE TO HATE

reviewText: As the best thing about LISA is its keen premise, I don't even want to reveal it.  If only the rest of the movie were that clever. LISA held my attention because I kept hoping its conclusion would reflect the wit of the setup but instead it wraps up with the too-usual rock 'em sock 'em inanity of these psycho-killer films. Too bad, as LISA wastes the talents of Staci Keanan, Cheryly Ladd and especially the ever-stalwart Jeffrey Tambor.
summary: The best part of the film is its premise

reviewText: I saw this movie many years ago. I think I was about 16 or 18. It was a great story and very dangerous. I remember when I was in high school me and some of my friends would "stalk" all the hunks! Ya'll I'm going to be honest. It was so much fun. We would follow them to class, sometimes we'd bump into them "on purpose" in the hallways just to get their attention. Then we'd all run around the corner giggling and laughing our heads off!! Those were the good old days.Now "Lisa" is a much darker film and it shows what could go wrong if you are admiring the wrong person. Overall great film, loved the end credits music.

reviewText: I, for the life of me will never understand these movie companies!  They keep turning out a lot of crappy old films to DVD and then you get a really good picture like this one (in which I often think about) and they delay putting this to DVD!  Someone is sleeping upstairs!  I can name quite a few movies they should have "hurried up " and convert to DVD.  Lisa is definitely one of them!!!!

reviewText: This movie is pretty underated, it has an original story and I love the girl who plays Lisa in this Stacy Keenan.  The guy who she becomes obsessed with is beyond hot, he's got that GQ 90's thing going on.  The ending is a bit predictable but it's still a good thriller type movie with good acting and writing.
